p: The electrode endurance was studied in open circuit conditions and dc current polarization. Figure 9 shows the symmetric cell impedance under OCV at 0 h compared with a constant current density of 200 mA cm −2 after 20 h and 40 h at 850 °C and 800 °C. It is possible to observe that under the electrical flow of direct current, the dc current flux produces an alteration in the electrode polarization resistance, increasing the electrolyte resistance and the polarization resistance, probably indicating an incipient reaction in the interface.
